text: Bottle from ABV. Spendy but worth it. Pours a jet black hue with a oily swirl of light beige head. A huge sugary nose, dark fruit and cognac. Very rich, oily viscous palate, dark fruit, ash, intense sweet barrels. Vanilla. Very good. Lovely beer. Huge but not cloying, complex.

Bottle thanks to Douglas. I asked him to find this for me and he decided to surprise me. 

A: Black body with a mocha head. Legs.

N: Bourbon, oak, cocoa, caramel, vanilla, rum, earth, coffee, oak, caramel, coconut, and shortbread.

T: Sweet and lightly bitter.

M: Heavy oily body, no alcohol, soft carbonation.

O: I can see how this got into the top 50. The blend of barrels works really well together, and this is very drinkable for 12%.
Bottle at Portland tasting. Very heavy root beer brown. Fruity, rich red. Sweet, leather brown. Rich bitter leather. Quite nice.

Bottle at Himmeriget. Copenhagen. Vintage 2017. Color is dark brown with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Coffee, chocolate, dryness, some bourbon and roasted malts. Dry and surprisingly drinkable.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Pours dark brown/black with minimal lacing. Strong bourbon which is awesome. Taste is bourbon and leather. Very nice!

2016 bottle drunk 3/18/17.Pours a very dark, viscous-looking ebony with a dark tan head atop showing moderate to moderately-strong retention.The nose is a good mix of lightly-to-moderately fudgey malts with light ash/char and more even roast. Bourbon-like notes emerge adding minimal spice and some liquor-like character but the barrel is reserved to mostly the coconut-like toastiness with strong vanilla as well. Its not overly boozy; doesnt seem raw, though the liquor and the 12% inevitably lead to some alcohol fumes. Lightly fruity and with some dry, bready and biscuity notes on the finish.In the mouth its soft and malty with moderate sweetness. Id prefer it even more dry, but its not a fudgey, syrupy mess, at least. Lots of toasted oak character, perhaps a bit heavy on it, with prunes, chocolate and caramel and a low but engaging carbonation. Lightly spicy whiskey-like notes with some minor warming from the alcohol. Nice stuff, though theres nothing particularly outstanding to me here.  Seems the slight amount of age has helped.

A graceful aroma featuring a blend of sweet bourbon, scotch, dark chocolate, vanilla, solid spice and booze heat. Chocolate first on taste, then the bourbon and heat kick in. Vanilla percolates in the aftertaste. Just OK; nowhere near what Id consider a top-50 imperial stout.

Batch 1. Mega intensywna beczka. Wanilia i bourbon. Paloność, gorzka czekolada, sos sojowy, ciemne owoce. Bardzo oleiste, lepka wręcz tekstura. Znakomity, długi finisz. Przepięknie ułożone i zbalansowane, wybitne piwo.
Strong barrel flavors here, strong bourbon and some port? Then all brownie batter. Some signature roastness in the finish but this is dominated with barrel notes.

22oz bottle thanks to Steve. First of the Jesus lineup. Normal inky black pour, small ring of head. Sweet, malty boozy aroma, molasses and wood. Taste is smooth, sweet and malty. Vanilla,brown sugar, bourbon. Syrupy and slick

22oz bottle thanks to Steve. Pours out pitch black topped with a tan head. Nose is rich malts booze bourbon barrel vanilla roast malts coffee. Taste is more of the nice roast malts chocolate sweetness bourbon barrel big booze and vanilla.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing pitch black with latte foam lacing. 

The nose shows notes of sweet molasses and light bourbon with no strong alcohol heat. This is promising. 

The palate is very full bodied and moderately but very gently carbonated. Lightly sweet with flavors of bourbon and a light vanilla background through out. Finish shows a light and gentle coffee bitterness. More gentle bourbon and lightly sweet molasses on the resurgence. No alcohol heat. Superb.

Bottle from Crafted Drafts. Pours black with a medium tan head. Nose of malt, rich chocolate, sweet bourbon and some roast. Malty flavor giving way to smooth bourbon, then chocolate, kind of like liquor-filled chocolates before a slightly roasty finish. Yeah, good.
22 ounce bottle. Chocolate sludge with a lot of barrel in it. Booze. Sticky. Slick. This is just delicious.

Shared at gregwilsonstl house. It poured a clear dark reddish / brown color with a brown head. The aroma was of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon and brown sugar. The taste was similar to the aroma with more dark chocolate, roasted malts, bourbon, oak and a nice smooth lingering chocolatey finish. The palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Really good.

Sampled at GregwilsonStLs tasting. Black with a bright tan ring. Chocolate aroma is deep and rich. Flavor, too. Smooth feel. This is heavy and rich. Heat is tasted. Massive malt flavors. Some soy and tobacco. Big flavors and a lot of good going on.
Booze dipped brownies. Vanilla. Fudge. Tasted at my "numbers and names" bottle share.

Consumed for Drink It Now day, hosted by GenDV138. Poured a pitch black color, small dark tan head. Aroma was lots of roasted malts, ton of chocolate. Flavor was roasted malts, creamy chocolate. Bold and pretty tasty. Alcohol sneaks in a bit.

The Well, Brooklyn bottle: pours black with a brown head. Aroma is a bunch of whisky, vanilla, loads of chocolate, sugar. Big and sweet. Some bitterness. Lots of chocolate and booze. Thick body. On the smooth side. Good.

Bottle shared at the Oirschot tasting. Pours pitch black with a thick mocha head. You can smell this is a thick one. Lots of rich sweet malts, bourbon, vanilla, creamy chocolate, nice roast to it, coffee, dried fruits, molasses, soy, bit of alcohol heat. Medium sweet and bitter. Loving the full body, with its thick oily texture. Low carbonation. This one is so chewy and dense.

Bottle @ tasting shared by Triggernils. Opaque black color, medium sized brown head. Aroma is malts, alcohol, roast, bourbon. Taste malts, bourbon, alcohol a bit too heavily imo, light sweetness, maybe wood / vanilla, firm bitter finish. Full body, thick texture, medium carbonation. Heavy, perhaps a tad too much.

Bottle courtesy of Benh (formerly of Ratebeer) up in the Meadowbank slums. It kept outrageous company on a night that saw many prestigious beers get popper. Great company from Bens beer pals. A carton of good eggs. The beer was black and predictably delicious. Im a sucker for Bourbon Barrel ageing on a strong Imperial stout so it was no effort to love this. I think I loved the Bruery Melange 15 more. Big thanks to Benh for making this happen.

Bottle at bens... Oh wow... Massive thanks.. Dark black.. Almost no head but dark brown .. Massive bourbon.. Dark chocolate roast nose.. Heavy meaty malts.. Massive chocolate.. Rich malts.. Heavy chocolate roast... Big bourbon roast.. Massive heavy chocolate nice but a tiny bit boozy

Foam OK. Molasses, molasses, molasses, soya, alcohol warmth, alcohol warmth in aroma and in taste. It is tasty but not very special in aroma, taste of palate in my opinion. I prefer the regular one. Bottle 2 years old; signs of oxidation (madeira, nutty, ..) no barrel effect perceived.

Huge thnx for sharing to Rood ! Pours black, small white head. Smell is full, intense roastyness, bit of the barrels. Taste is heavy, thick, barrel, bourbon, Sharp, soy sauce. Dark sugar. Bit boozy. Bit to the sweet side. Not bad

Pours black with minimal brown oily head 
Aromas of soy, bourbon, coffee, dried fruits, 
Taste has creamy notes of coffee, bourbon, muscavado, alcohol, dried fruits

Pours black with low deep and dark tan head. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, coffee. Taste is sweet, boozy, chocolate, alcohol warming... Incredibly complex and so fulfilling. Body is rich and creamy with a silky smooth, almost velvety carbonation.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, muscovado sugar, roasted malt, roasted nuts, caramel, oak character, slight tobacco. Taste is quite sweet with roasted notes and chocolate tones. Some boozy notes and oak character. Mouthfeel is full bodied with low carbonation and quite oily. Fantastic stuff!

It is a very long time since I have had this good a beer.....which wasent an Oude Geuze. The barrels are perfectly integrated in a deep deep nose, the oily slick texture, the long warm finish.....PERFECT!

Aroma: chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, cherry, roasty, oak
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, roasty, vanilla, cherry, chocolate, marshmallows

Bottle at Himmeriget, may 12th 2016. Black body with no head. Roasty aroma with whisky, licorice, dark fruit, leather, choco. Taste is roasted bitter with a sweet vanilla presence, layers of coffee, whisky and cocoa playing, with a dark chocolate finish. An outstanding beer!

September 18, 2015. Bottle, received in a trade, thanks! 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is malty with subtle barrel notes, caramel, dark chocolate, roasted coffee, licorice, vanilla, hints of oak and bourbon. Taste is sweet, malty, roasted bitterness and very light boozy. Finish is bitter roasted malt with dark chocolate and coffee, sweet caramel, hints of prunes, vanilla and some sweet and slightly warming bourbon notes. Full bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Very nice!

650 ml bottle from trade with RobertDale. Thank you Bob!! Malty aroma, roasted, dark dried fruits, chocolate, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and heavy bitter like aroma with cocoa addition. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty bourbon licorice chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody bourbon licorice and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon licorice and chocolate finish.

(Sample from a bottle kindly offered at Himmeriget, May 15 2016) Black pour with a minimal tan head. Aroma is quite rich and fairly sweet with layers of burnt sugar, dark chocolate, molasses, vanilla beans, bourbon, oak, fudge, a bit of char. Flavour follows the same map - the layers of burnt sugar types, bourbon, wood, chocolate, a bit of fruitiness, smoky roast. Rather syrupy but not cloying, its just flat out rich and complex. Long finish with no real booze at all. Full body, viscous, very low carbonation. Really lovely stuff, must have more at some juncture!

Bottle share @ DLD 2016. Pour is basically black with a very small tan head. Flavor and aroma of bourbon, chocolate, oak, brown sugar, licorice, and slight leather. Finish is boozy with some added notes of smoke.

[5/10/16] Bottle at Himmeriget in Copenhagen. Opaque black. Wonderful aroma with lots of chocolate, bourbon, fudge, vanilla, pralines. Sweet flavor with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, a bit of alcohol and a bit of bitterness. Full-bodied. Wonderful.
22oz bottle pours a thick black color with a bit of brown head. Rich complex barrel flavors. Smooth. Great balance of flavors.

Bottle from Himmelriget. Mainly rated from memory and minor notes. While cooled, the aroma was mainly bourbon. As it warmed up aroma turned into vanilla, oak, chocolate, roasted malts and the bourbon in a symbiosis. Taste of sweet vanilla, toffee, bourbon, while the roasted malts was kept in the background. Sweet aftertaste with bourbon taste and notes of vanilla. Quite oily mouthfeel with low carbonation. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Bottled. Pours pitch black with a small, lacing and tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, dark fruit notes, chocolate and coffee. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with some alcohol. Full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great and complex Impy. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Pours oily black like motor oil, with tan brown head.
Aroma: rich dark malts aroma, which takes on roasted, burnt sugar, bittersweet chocolate, espresso coffee, molasses, port wine, vanilla, coca nibs, bourbon...
Flavors are practically the same: intense roasted flavor, with notes of espresso coffee, bittersweet chocolate, molasses, burnt sugar, hint of smoked, port wine, vanilla, dark fruits, cocoa nibs, supported with gentle bourbon note. Finish is slightly bitter dry, and roasted. Alcohol warmth is gentle noticeable, beer is drinkable like 7-8%, but after a few minutes knocks you in your knees. Body is full, texture soft, carbonation is low.
Raging bull.
Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours opaque black with a slight brown head. Aroma is caramel, cocoa and vanilla. Taste is roast malts, roast coffee, coffee bitter, vanilla sweey, caramel sweet. Full body.

Bottle from a kind stranger as part of a complex swap. This was the end of a long night of stout tastings, but it still came through completely above the other ones we tasted, rich and complex. Really thick, tons of chocolate, and loads of complexity. Yum.

Pours pitch black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, treacle, coffee notes, brown sugar, dark fruits, bourbon. Full Body. Soft carbonation. Bourbon and coffee finish. Great.
66 bottle. Black with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, oak chocolate, alcohol and bitterness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - inky black pour with beige head. Roasted and sweet malty with chocolate, cake like, caramel, treacle, some coffee notes, brown sugar, dark fruits, bourbon infused wooden nuances, beautiful.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at part of Blue Monks Bottle Blowout. Dark black pour, tan head. Just about what youd expect....heavy, strong, bourbon vanilla flavor. Pretty great.

Pours a thicker, motor oil black color with an immediately disappating small, dark brown head.

Very Bourbon forward on the nose, with a multi layered spiciness to it, which gets balanced by burned malts and bitter chocolate. The prominent barrel characteristics feature an apple sweetness, blending into cinnamon and flowery, caramel coated vanilla. 

Drinks truly smooth, while producing an oak covered barrel bite during the finish, with a subdued, fitting, lower carbonation, featuring the beers complex body in a perfect fashion. 

Tastes of soft whipped cream, warm oak, and a big load of milk chocolate, which slowly turns more and more into a bitter chocolate direction, backed up by dried tobacco and burned malts. Sweet toffee, fudge and mousse au chocolate provide a nice, balancing sweetness, getting amped up by the spicy, yet pleasantly integrated barrel. This creates a breathtaking, well accentuated complexity, with a chocolate coated Bourbon bite prevailing. Finishes with its initial smooth chocolate qualities, with some alcohol soaked apple peel and lots of cinnamon cutting through, among cream soothed glazed toffee. 

A truly extreme beer as for spicy, dry Bourbon gets challenged by utmost creamy, smooth chocolate, exhibiting an intriguing interplay with almost charred, lingering malts. This holds up to its well build taste diversity, uniting far reaching contrasts on the palate, mostly due to a soothing cream smoothness, calming the potent Bourbon bite, and the omnipresent malt bill perfectly well.

Pour that pitch black you know and love, with as good as no head. 
Aroma is jammed packed with bourbon goodness, dark fruits, oatmeal, dark chocolate, roasted bitter malts, plenty of licorice, asphalt, burnt Brown sugar. To me it feels like this want to run you ower, regarding everything thats going on. - rape incoming. - has some slight green hoppy notes to it. 
Taste is rather bitter, but deffinitly has some sweetness to it. But still it wants 
Your A-hole. 
Rather full bodied, with a somewhat flat carbonation. Meh - let me be the submissive
22oz bottle thanks to my man Raul. pours a dark oily black with a tan khaki head, nice bourbon whiskey oak taste with a chocolate fudge vanilla and coffee finish

22 oz. bottle, pours a jet black like motor oil with a tiny brown head. Nose is complex as hell, with loads of bourbon barrels, followed by coffee, cocoa and brown sugar. Flavour is likewise complex, with smoky bacon bits, bourbon barrels, cocoa and coffee. Amazingly complex - so many elements that blend harmoniously. Finishes with coffee and bourbon. Fantastic stuff.

22 oz. bottle thanks to AdamC. Pitch black, thick tan head. Aroma has a thick brownie batter character with whiskey and deep charred grain. 
This is my kind of imperial stout!! Thick full, dense body with a creamy mouthfeel. The deep roasted grain, with the whiskey and light dark fruits. Gosh the brownie batter is so awesome. Deep roasted grain for days.... Im glad Adam gave me an extra ounce of this at our recent tasting, pimping!!!
 Note to self, Imperial Stout rating number 400, Boom!!

Bomber shared by AdamChandler. Big thanks, Adam! Excited to try this. Pours nearly black with a beige head. Big whiskey nose, chocolate, molasses, a touch of coffee. This is thick, full mouth, all the flavors from the aroma. Big and tasty!
Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler dark black brown with a creamy tan head. Aromas of whiskey molasses and burnt oak. Taste is dark chocolate caramel whiskey and oak. Thanks Adam.

Bomber, split 5 ways

A - Pitch black, totally an oil bomb. Pours like oil, no head even formed.

S - Theres a lot of whiskey aroma here. Smells a bit like burnt oak with marshmallow, molasses and bourbon. 

T - Certainly a distinct marshmallow taste with a ton of molasses and aunt jemima syrup...really seems fitting Booze is refined and well balanced. A lot of dark chocolate and syrupy tastes. Just a great overall well-balanced taste

M - Dense, thick, good tight carbonation bubbles. Lingering molasses taste

O - Fantastic, well made Imperial Stout.I like how theres so little booze in here.

Un immense merci à Patrick pour cette bière fabuleuse qui donne fièrement le coup de départ dune superbe soirée! 
Un liquide absolument irréprochable : dense, riche, sirupeux... Une surface légèrement huileuse est tout-à-fait appropriée. Un nez puissant de bourbon, de whisky, de réglisse noire, de crème brûlée et de vieux bois de grange. Je pourrais passer des heures à humer les vapeurs complexes et chaudes de ce liquide noir et défiant. Un mouthfeel mi mince absolument prodigieux tant cest soyeux et vivant, ponctué par une douce effervescence et un alcool qui me pique la langue. Ma bouche est immédiatement emplie de saveurs riches dun double baril tissé serré. Une amertume modérée par des houblons qui ont dû est massivement employés dans le brassage pour équilibrer limpressionnante quantité de malts rôtis et de bois alors que tout demeure parfaitement équilibré. Un immense coup de coeur pour moi!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

(Dégustation avec kzeon et yourilevesque. Merci à Alex pour linvitation!) Une coulée lourde, liquoreuse, et aussi belle avec cette mousse délicate. Un nez qui na pas de bon sens. Des gaufrettes chocolatées, des pralines belges, du bourbon caramélisé, du porto à la noix de coco, des fruits dans le cognac, du chêne vanillé. Riche et complexe, il va sans dire. Un goût intensément malté, arrondi par les alcools fins, fruité, doux et jamais trop sucré. Wow! Cest très bon, cest équilibré, cest presque facile à boire. En bouche, le liquide est épais, concentré, soyeux, épatant pour le palais. En finale, cest la réunion de tous les meilleurs éléments, lalcool riche, la douceur des malts, lamertume des malts et les fruits. En résumé, tout simplement superbe.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with medium creamy tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong bourbon, roast, chocolate. Thick mouth, chewy, roasted malt, dark chocolate, wood, great barrel presence, really impressive.

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of brown foam. Aromas of roasted malt, bitter chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon and light brown sugar. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark chocolate, roasted malt, light bourbon and light oak with a smooth lingering roasty chocolate finish.

Bomber shared at Grizzleys. Super dark pour with dark tan head. Aroma is boozy wood, molasses, chocolate. Taste follows. Super rich, thick mouth feel. Sweet and boozy all at once. Really amazing stuff.
Bomber shared at Grizzlys. Dark oily dense pour with a dark tan head. Molasses, wood, dark chocolate. Rich. Dense mouthfeel. Damn, this is awesome.

22oz bottle via trade. finally getting a chance to tick this top 50 imperial stout. pours a deep, dense, rich black capped by the beautiful rusty, clay colored head. aroma is huge roast, cacao chocolate, oak, bourbon, fruity cognac, figs, dates, and subtle coffee. flavor is where this one truly sets itself apart from your above average imperial stout. massive roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, toffee, woody bourbon, malts balls, and caramel corn are complimented by a dry, oaky finish with hints of dark fruits. palate is thick, dense, rich, and never cloying with a lingering roasty finish. overall, an absolute world class imperial stout.
A: black/very dark brown, no head. N: Plum, dried fruits, bourbon, vanilla, molasses, sugar cane T: coffee, cocoa, dried fruits, bourbon O: Heavy BA imperial Stout. Heat from alcohol. Very very nice!

Bottle at Ratebeer Kvillebäcken Winter Gathering, 151127. Opaque black beer with a nice beige/brownish head. Chocolate aroma, raisins, cocoa powder, licorice, raisins, caramel, vanilla, wood, figs, some cream. Roasted chocolate flavor, burnt wood, licorice, hazelnuts, warming alcohol, figs, raisins, slightly spicy. full bodied with a balanced chocolate and vanilla finish.

Cheers Randal. Pours jet black with a small quickly dissapating brown head. Aroma is intense roasted soy sweet bourbon vinous chocolate. Flavor is fullbodied smooth ashy sweet chocolate coffee, has a pleasant boozysweet and bitterness with a touch of acidity.

22oz bottle into cup. Minneapolis. 

Pours jet black with mocha head. 

Aroma is heavy on chocolate, coffee, whiskey, charred oak. 

Taste is sweet with bitter subtleness at the end. 

Mouthfeel is really nice. Rich and full. Long finish. 

Overall this is really nice. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a dark brown with a short lived frothy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, vanilla, alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich alcoholic sweet malt palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of massive bourbon, vanilla, fudge, oak, chocolate, dark fruits coming out, boozy but not in a bad way, light coffee notes, brownies and light coconut notes. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin tan ring head. Clear black pour. Wow! A lovely complex beer with nice bourbon notes.

22 oz bottle shared by DrSilverworm. Pours dark brown to black in color with a thin khaki colored film. The aroma and flavor have huge dark roasted malts, dark fruits, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, a subtle smoked character, fudge, some sweetness is lingering, the barrel is well integrated into the base beer, great blend.
Bottle from travis. Black color tan head. Big barrel and tootsie roll aroma. Taste is sweet fudge oak, vanilla

From notes. Enjoyed on September 19 at Travis house. Poured from a 22 oz bottle. This makes up for everything that was Even More Jesus. The pour is a thick, oily black with a dark brown cap of head and no lace as it falls to a film. The aroma is great. Its a little hot, but thats the only knock. Lots of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, and dark fruits. There is an obvious booze here, but the other components are just great. The flavor is big on a bourbon aspect to go with the chocolate, light roast, and solid vanilla. There is a nice sweetness on the back end that I wasnt expecting to see. Its almost like a dark fruit molasses. The mouth feel is thick and chewy with a soft carbonation that is just incredibly thick. The aftertaste is lingeringly roasty and boozy, with just enough sweetness to keep it from being off-putting.

Bottle shared in NH. It pours darkest brown - black with a decent light tan head. The nose is very rich, oily, big chocolate cake vibe, earth, toasty, toffee, vanilla, nougat, dark fruits and wood. The taste is slick, oily, warming alcohol upfront, toffee, chocolate, sweet bourbon, cocoa, toasted coconut, charred wood and rocky road with a warming finish. Full body and average carbonation. Big, rich and decadent. Pretty punchy and warming stuff. Nice.

Bottle shared in NH @ Leightons Stag. Pours deep black/brown, thin tan/brown head. Aroma is big bourbon, vanilla, cocoa, sweet malt, coffee. Flavor is cocoa, big bourbon, sweet chocolate frosting, heavy but smooth booze on the finish. Big and full bodied, really really smooth. Great stuff.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Bottle shared in Canaan, NH. Big thanks to Dander for tracking this down. Pours oily black with a creamy brown head. Big aroma, lots of vrownies, chocolate, roast. Medium to big sweet flavor, some burnt wood, scorched earth, lots of layered chocolate, some burnt marshmallows, light vanilla. Full bodied, chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish, buckets of chocolate, some ripe dark fruits, raisins, some wood, slight twisted caramel, coconut, vanilla, more brownies. Well, just immensely layered. Quite chocolatey. Great barrel integration. Very potent, but still really drinkable. Outstanding.

Bomber courtesy of Hackobock. Pours viscous black with a very thin mocha head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, dark roast coffee, high quality dark chocolate, molasses and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty. Mouthfeel is fat, round, creamy, slightly astringent, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, coconut milk, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Big and decadent BA impy. Bit hot perhaps but overall very tasty.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, wood, raw sugar, toffee, caramel, licorice and leather. Taste is medium sweet and light bodied with notes of raw sugar, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, sweet booze, light leather, licorice and light toffee. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Super good, very complex.

22 oz bottle at ChurchKey shared with a friend and the bar staff. Black with light tan head. Aromas of bourbon, dark chocolate, dark fruit, maple syrup, oak. Tastes of dark chocolate, bourbon, light booze and oak. Full body with a dry finish. Very well masked for 12% ABV. Fantastic blend.
Without having side by side, cant tell a big difference with this one. Still a very big n smooth body, fudge with hints of smoke. Friggin tasty.

Bottle. Starless, midnight black with a dark brown head. Boozy nose with strong dark chocolate, molasses, vanilla, roasted malt, espresso and hints of soy and dark fruit. Taste is huge dark chocolate, vanilla, booze, molasses, dark fruit notes, chocolate candy bar, coffee notes, roasted malt and caramel. Sticky and full bodied with a dense, bubbly and creamy carbonation. Ends with more vanilla, molasses, dark chocolate, candy bar, roasted malt, coffee, booze and burnt caramel. Delicious but Im not sure its worth the $25.99 I paid for it.

22 oz. bottle shared by DrSilverworm - thanks again, Chris, for sharing this long-time want. Pours an inky, opaque midnight brown that is more of a cocoa shade around the edges and when it reaches the bottom. Small brown head that settles into a tiny ring that leaves some wisps of film and spots in the glass. Decadent, fudgy aroma, with raisins, vanilla, bourbon, cocoa, toasted brown sugar, and mellow roast. The flavor is smokier and roastier where the aroma was sweeter - deep roasted malts, charred oak, burnt sugar, vanilla, dark and milk chocolate, and a warming bourbon throughout it all. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a roasty, boozy, barely ashy mouthfeel with just a bit of balancing sweetness. Doesnt linger like expected, nor does it coat the palate for as long as initially expected. Excellent barrel-aged imperial stout.

22oz bottle, from Dutchs (we only got 6). Shared with Ratebeer friends. Pours impressively pitch black. Thin brown head, fades to a ring. Leaves some kinda loose bits of lace. Awesome big barrel and stout character, such big flavor. Dark chocolate, liqueur-soaked dark chocolate cake, batter, bit of brown sugar, nice mocha. Good complex barrel character (bourbon, maybe something else?). Awesome big barrel, but not harsh or too boozy. Definitely a touch of warmth, but its not unpleasant. Moderate-plus bitter, nice big sweet but not at all cloying. Bigger body. Nice chewy velvety texture. Light carbonation. Mild slick. Some dark fruit character. Delicious, big barrel aged stout. Fantastic. I poured maybe 175ml max and that was more than enough for me to fall in love and type all this. Sitll have a third of the glass to enjoy, and thats totally OK. This is a beer to share, sip and savor.

Bomber to snifter (shared by DrSilverworm). Looks good; a fairly opaque very dark (almost black) cola with thin beige head that dissipates into thin lacing pretty quickly. Smells great! Rich and decadent with loads of dark malt, chocolate, oak, some vanilla, and what seems like a bit bourbon. Tastes like it smells, but a bit less balanced. Still great though. Some bitterness and booziness on the tongue. Mouthfeel is medium-full to full-bodied. Delicious.

650 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Inky black. Medium khaki head. Thick collar. Smell is whiskey and fudge. More fudge than whiskey, though. A little wood. Slightly fruity. Fudgy taste. Nice whiskey. Lots of rich chocolate. I cant discern barrels. Just lots of whiskey. Some bitter coffee in the back end. Boozy. Medium heavy. Well carbonated. Simple, but huge stout. Great flavors that get a little sluggish.

Bottle courtesy of Ozark_John, thanks JB! Pours near black, brown hues and a pillowing brown head that recedes to a cap. Nice lacing on the glass and a solid pair of legs. Aromas are pretty bold bourbon, rye, wet oak, chocolate, anise, tobacco and hints of vanilla. Smells hot! Taste is more balanced than expected, but still provides a very prominent barrel character. Loads of chocolate, coffee, toffee, caramel, anise, allspice, tobacco, dark fruits-cherry/raisin, notes of sherry. Medium to heavy body, never chewy...but with the big bourbon/rye on the finish, I feel like more body would have provided a bit more balance here. Nice depth to the beer, no doubt. Just can say it was as amazing as some of the other Imperial Stouts of its class. Solid beer, none the less!

22 ounce bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, and bourbon. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coffee, dark fruit, and some molasses. They got this on blended perfectly.

Near black, opaque body with a thin, beige collar that rapidly fades to a thin wispy cap. Grandiose aroma of bourbon, chocolate, dark roast, chocolate covered raisins, sweet booze, oak. Incredibly rich. European style roast with notes of plum and raisin. Thick body. Palate coating. Mild sweetness with lingering dark chocolates and perhaps some residual dark cherry tones. Delicious.

Bottle thanks to dd07! Pours inky thick black, medium dark brown creamy head that dissipates slowly and laces well. Aroma is rich and decadent, lots of barrel influence with whiskey, vanilla, and port notes, chocolate, roasted malts. Flavor is medium sweet, and medium bitter, roasty, chocolate, vanilla, port, whiskey, oak, some tobacco, a touch of anise, molasses. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, a bit hot. Pretty tasty beverage.

Bottle. Black pour with a small head that fades to a thin ring. Great aroma of chocolate fudge, cookie dough, light roast, and tobacco. Tastes even more complex. Thick chocolate syrup, tobacco, light espresso, vanilla, light rum, cookie dough, and caramel. Medium to full body. Great, complex beer but I surprisingly still like the regular version better.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Toffee, chocolate, roasted and sweet aromas. Dry finish, with bourbon and other liquor tones, other sweet tones.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 2900th review! 22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled in 2014. Pours dense pitch black color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense dark brown head with solid retention, that reduces to a spotty lace cap that lingers. Some slight lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, fudge, licorice, dark bread, spicy rye, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, raisin, prune, tobacco, light smoke/char, and roast/smokey earthiness. Fantastic aromas with incredible complexity and balance of big dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, fudge, licorice, dark bread, spicy rye, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, raisin, prune, tobacco, light smoke/char, and roast/smokey earthiness. Fair amount of roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, fudge, licorice, dark bread, spicy rye, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, raisin, prune, tobacco, light smoke/char, and roast/smokey earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of huge dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; with an awesome roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and very full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, slick, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is fantastic. Alcohol is well hidden with only a small warming present after the finish. Overall this is a world class barrel aged imperial stout. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; and quite smooth to sip on for the huge ABV.  Very similar to Even More Jesus with some mellower deep roasted character and added rye and barrel complexity. An insanely delicious offering.

shared bottle by a friend, poured a deep dark colour with a mocha head, dark bitter roasted chocolate up front, roasted malts, strong bitter hop notes, caramel, rye, small hint of bourbon, spice, dark fruit, dark coffee, vanilla, some chocolatef fudge, dark fruits, hard to say... i can;t say that i like this one more as the port barrel version, lets just say I was expecting a lot more. bit of a let down.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy chocolate, molasses, light espresso, vanilla, bourbon, and faint oak. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small khaki head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a very fine ring. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy chocolate, molasses, and faint caramel. The finish has light cinnamon, vanilla, and a touch of bourbon. Its medium-full bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Bottle: Thanks, Darshaun. Pours jet black like used motor oil. Thick, viscous. A frothy, deep-tan foam forms on top, looks like an expensive latte foam. Fades quick to a skimpy collar. Aroma is huge in presence with strong woody & barrel laden notes right out of the gate. Spicy bourbon spiked dark chocolate fudge with sweet hints of vanilla, toasted graham cracker, burnt anise, & sweet cake batter. Wow. Tastes like liquid Devils Food cake laced with bourbon & oak chips. Crazy brown batter vibe with heavy-ass vanillin from the barrel. Charred brown sugar, bittersweet cocoa, & a mild touch of dark fruit in the back-end. I get a "spicy" note that almost reminds me of cinnamon coated graham crackers... Not as vibrant as youd get from something like Mexi Cake or Hunahpu, but I definitely get a mild cinnamon joint from this jam. Thick ass mouth feel with a lingering bourbon fudge brownie batter finish. I loved Even More Jesus & this adds a nice twist. Both are fantastic.

Take the Even More Jesus and slam it in some bourbon barrels and youve got the double barrel jesus. Pours like a moonless midnight with a toffee head. Notes of roasted coffee, licorice and vanilla. The bourbon creeped in with a well balanced smooth finish. Was the perfect finish to christmas dinner.

22 oz bomber split 4 ways. Pour is pitch black with a generous beige head. Nose has some roast, freshly ground coffee, vanilla, dark chocolates and some light ash. Taste is super smooth, some light soy, tar, chocolate, tobacco and some licorice. Really well made stuff!

Big thanks to Jeppe. Pours black with a dark brown head. I loved EMJ so this one must be good as well - Lets see! Aroma has loads of dark chocolate on the bitter side of the chocolate-scale, lots of roasted coffee notes, vanilla, dark dried fruits, some dry wood, roasted malts and a very weak hint of whiskey. Very subtle barrel-character on the nose for me on this one. The taste is very roasted and has notes of dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted coffee, dry wood, weak tobacco, dark dried fruits and some sweeter caramel tip of thing as well. The barrel character is subtle here as well but is still giving the beer a nice edge of dryness and a wooden feel which kinda makes this a decadent SOB to sip on. Different than I expected, especially after tasting the B.A Biscotti, but I like it - A lot!

Oh jesus! Bomber thanks to Jeppe! Pours the nicest pitch black with a brown, fluffy head. Aroma is very roasty with, coffee, licorice, lots of roasty and some caramel malts. The barrel charater is very wooden and not so sweet. More whiskey than bourbon, but overall some very elegant barrel notes. Some chocolate and some molasses as well, but still not very sweet. Taste is very roasty as well. High roasty bitterness with coffee, licorice, slight dark chocolate, hints of bourbon, but again more of the dry whiskey barrel character. Not sweet nor smokey, but just the plain whiskey character. Slight boozy heat in the end. Nice, full body and low carb. Really good, but still slightly disappointing.

Bottle. Thanks to Jeppe! Pours pitch black with a thick, mocca head. Aromas of some barrel characters, whisky, slight bourbon, some smoke, some coffee beans, dark chocolate, licorice. Taste is pretty roasted up front, lots of ashy notes, slight smoke, licorice, wood, roasted coffee, some fudge, dark sweet fruits, some dark bitter chocolate.

65 cl bottle. Thanks Tiong!
Pours pitch black color with a minimal beige head. Very intense cocoa aroma, dark chocolate, some mild alcohol notes, faint vanilla and bourbon. Quite intense flavor too; almost oily thick viscosity, bourbon, some vanilla, dark malts and coffee. The palate here is just awesome, creamy smooth chocolaty feel, extremely thick body with a tangy wooden caramel finish. This is just awesome, one of the most intense brews Ive tasted in a long, long time.
5426

650 ml bottle. Cheers tiong and grats for tick #4000. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of roastiness, wood, some dark chocolate, biscuit and grass. Flavour is really smooth with strong roasted malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, earthiness, quite heavy bitterness, tart wooden notes and some mild smoked notes. The smokiness here is quite unique. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Rich, smooth and in a brilliant balance. Cheers Jeppe.

65 cl bottle @ tiong, no BBE info Thanks tiong!
Aroma has strong vanilla tones, some alcohol and licorice. Flavour has strong vanilla and whisky notes. Also stingy and rubbery with woody tones. Very close to recent vintage of Goose Island Bourbon County  just more sweet and sharp with the whiskey. Couple of years and this ought to be even better. A slow sipper that maintains its taste and is quite nice when  enjoyed as one.

Rating #4000!

650ml bottle from APEX, Portland, OR @ Varjopikkujoulut

Pours pitch black with a brown head and a huge viscocity. Aroma of cocoa, roasty malts, wood, oak, vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate and espresso. Taste is heavy, sweet and slick with some roastiness, syrup, dark chocolate, espresso and loads of barrel notes, smoked wood, oak, vanilla and bourbon. Finish is slick, slightly sweetish but not overly so, woody and stingy bourbony with some roastiness, dark chocolate, espresso, cocoa and vanilla. Exquisite. Heavy and slow sipper with loads of flavors. Balanced and delicate. Great stuff.

Ugh, very messy notes from a long day of stouts at Keiths. Lightly boozy, roasty, coffe with a woody vanilla aroma. Black pour with a brown head. Very coffee forward, roasted. Lightly sweet, a tad thin, and lots of scribble.

Inky black pour with one finger of dark tan head. Nose is rich, woody and bourbon/oaky upfront in the notes. Some alcoholic heat comes through. Licorice and fruit skins with some burnt sugar. Full bodied and viscous. Very nice.

Bottle (thanks to goodbyeohio for sharing)... Poured jet black with a thin forming, tan head. Strong wood barrel notes with a hint of charred, smokey grains. Some sweetness, vanilla, grains, sweet cream... But not as insanely sweet as I was expecting. Hints of cocoa, roasted malts, and boozy heat. Just like the sweetness, not as crazy with alcohol presence as I was expecting.
Sweet, roasty, bourbon, boozy, oaky aroma. Thick dark black, brown head. Big roasty flavor, sweet, coffee, chocolate, lots of booze and barrel character, like double.

From the December 2014 3R6P tasting. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a small foamy dark brown head that left decent lacing. The aroma was dough, marzipan and sweet chocolate syrup. The flavor was malty with dough, marzipan, chocolate syrup, dark fruits, bourbon and a boozy presence. Long boozy dark fruit finish. Moderately full bodied. Booziness grows and starts to distract. Interesting.
Bottle. Poured a dark brown color with an off white head. Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, some roast, and dark fruits. Rich, decadent and delicious.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours pitch-black with a small, creamy, brown head. Great retention. The flavor is a decadent marriage of gooey fudge and quality liquor. Although nice, the multi-barrel blend removes the defining characteristics of each spirit involved. Full-bodied and creamy with Key West carbonation. The flavor is chocolaty and deeply roasted with a medium amount of singed, carbonic bitterness. Finishes boozy and soul-warming. After only one pour, Im feelin no pain. Thanks goes out to ctipping for providing this world class beer!
This poured a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma was of Bourbon, fudge and dark fruit. Flavor was similar, pretty hot, but not overly sweet and tasty.
Bottle from a trade. Pours a deep dark black brown without much head. Aromas of vanilla bourbon and cocoa. Taste is sweet with bourbon heat. Maybe a bit too hot. Medium body. Medium mouthfeel.
Bottle shared thanks to artmcd8. Poured thick black with beige head. Aroma of light maple bourbon bitter choc. Light carb med bod. Bitter choc bourbon crazy.

Poured a dark hazlenut brown with thin layer of white soapy head. Flavor and taste of bourbon, oak, roasted nuts and coffee. Deep flavor with a thick mouthfeel. Really solid beer which abv destroyed me after drinking to my face

Bottle. Black pour with Brown ring. Aroma is decadent: cinnamon, chocolate, coffee and smoke. Taste is sweet chocolate and spicy. Very perfumy and aromatic, but palate is a little light for such a big brew. Good stout.

Bottle from trade. Excited about this one. Pours pitch black and thick with a half finger dark brown creamy head on top. Aroma of dark fruits, chocolate covered raisins, whiskey and oak, molasses, anise. Flavor follows with anise and dark fruits, chocolate, sweet molasses, and a long vanilla bourbon finish alongside a hint of cocoa powder. Really really smooth, not at all boozy, thick and rich, low carbonation. Really easy drinking and a beautifully made BA stout. While its on the fruit and molasses side of the flavor profile than I like, theres no question that this a beautifully made brew. Would have it any time. Right there with Uncle Jacobs with a somewhat similar flavor profile. Yum.

Bottle to glass. Pours a pitch black color, with a thin rim of brown head. Beautiful bourbon, spice, vanilla, roasted malts in the aroma and flavor. Lingering bourbon and spice in the finish. Delicious.

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks bro! pours very dark brown with a small beige dark crema cap, reviving and leaving some lacing. sweet molasses and raisins, chocolate syrup, perfumey booze - lilac, pine, coffee and cream, wood, vanilla. light carbonation, medium to full body - oily and thick, boozy and sweet coffee finish. good stuff!

Bottle 660ml.
Pours very dark brown with very low beige "head". No lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, alcohol, lots of bourbon. Taste is of chocolate, bitterness, sugar, bourbon. Palate: Full bodied. Low carbonation. Overall: Very nice imperial stout.

Pours a nice black with a milk chocolate head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of vanilla and chocolate, just like a big fat chocolate cake. Taste is of chocolate, light alcohol, oak and bourbon. Body is full, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is just sticky/thick. Overall this was a nice imperial stout, not sure about the double barrel thing, but still really nice.

Bottle (22 oz). From cparles, thanks! Pitch black with a small dark brown head and little lacing. Aroma is quite perfume at first but it then settle down and leave more place to the coffee, bourbon, vanilla and light fruitiness. Taste is sweet (not cloying though) coffee forward with moderate bourbon notes, fruity presence, perfume notes (less than in the aroma, but they stay longer) and vanilla notes. Full bodied. Moderate carbonation. Warming finish. Rich and complex. Good barrel aged RIS but inferior to most of the other Jesus versions.

Bottle at tasting. Oily black pour. Aroma is perfumey, intense bourbon and vanilla notes, sweet, sweet vanilla, light roasty notes, hint of coffee. Taste is sweet, molasses, rich chocolate flavors, really on the sweet decadent side, vanilla, lots of sweet flavors but not actually super sweet and cloying. Palate is rich, mouth coating with light warming alcohol. Very tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Bottle. Dark brown pour with a chocolate head. Chocolate and caramel aromas. Dark roasted malts, some bitterness. Cheap bourbon. Really like the base beer on this one, but not my favorite barrel treatment.
Bottle - pours dark black. Bourbon, oak, chocolate in the nose. Lots of chocolate and fudgy in the taste. Some sweeteness and booze. Pretty good!

Bottle. The pour is dark with a thin carmel head. The aroma is a perfect blend of barrel and dark stout. The taste is smooth as well. Good barrel flavor and robust stout flavor. A little too big of a bite to it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer is black and looks quite thick. Very small head, dark brown. Small ring of bubbles. The aroma is very big on chocolate with mild fruitiness and roast, and then, theres a strong, complex spirit barrel note. All sorts of stuff going in there. Big on vanilla. Some grape and spice. Tons of dark molasses. Caramel sweetness. Moderately acidic. Solid alcoholic kick in the taste but it works with the huge sweetness of the beer. This is liquid fudge with a spirit bonanza on top. More of the roast and coffee come out in the taste. Its definitely dessert in a glass, but the barrel flavor cleans things up pretty well in the finish with tannic oak and heat. Raisins, caramel, even more molasses. Cherries and grapes. Chocolate dominates but all of the other flavors play nicely. Very full mouthfeel. Its decadently silky and thick. This is a wonderful imperial stout. In terms of spirits, I mostly get rye, but theres a depth to it that most barrel-aged stouts lack.
I had this at a cocktail bar of all places, wasnt expecting much but what I love about beer is getting constantly surprised. Nice booze, chocolate, malt, nicely balanced.

Bomber, thanks Paul, this stuff rocks. Midnight black pour. Thin yet creamy tan head. Bourbon, chocolate covered caramel turtles, smoke. Just the right balance between sweet, booze, and dark malt. As far as straight up bourbon stouts this might be in the top 3 behind bourbon county and bba dark lord.

Sometimes making a great beer better isnt always easy...barrel aging is a complicated process, and I have had many beers where something went wrong. DBJ however; does not have any of these issues. Excellent balance from start to finish. Chocolate, some alcohol notes and oak are present in the aroma. The taste is rich and bold. Huge whiskey-chocolate notes and shortbread cookies with slight heat from the barrel. Mildly heavy on the palate and delicious with a clean finish. This beer lives up to the hype!! Seek it out now! Cheers!
logging this in from untappd to synchronize all my beers into rate beer for better statistics.

Bottle at Edmunds Oast. Pitch black pour with a thick brown head. Big fudgy aroma, oak, vanilla, Bourbon, roasted malts, earth, licorice with touches of dark fruits. Thicky chewy fudge browines, vanilla, roasted malts, earth, whipped cream and oak fill the mouth. Velvety, lucious mouthfeel and smooth carbonation. Damn fine.
Dark brown with a dark khaki head. Aroma is brownie, fudgie. Some chocolate. Notes of vanilla, bourbon, a little boozy. Full bodied, delicious.
Bottle split with some peeps. Pours dark, dark khaki head. Lots of fudge brownie, vanilla, bitter chocolate, milk chocolate, bourbon. Thick but slightly creamy body. Slight booze burn.

22 oz bottle. Great name! Mahogany with oily tan froth. Nose is fudge, espresso, molasses, oak and bourbon. Creamy, almost full body, with a sharp tang. This one is massive if a bit over done. Taste is dark chocolate, wood, cane sugar and soft bourbon. Even though the flavors are huge the base beer is kind of simple. The barrels impart just enough bourbon to add a complimentary layer of complexity. Excellent work.

Big beer, exceptionally well done. Motor oil consistency, midnight black in color. Solid base stout. If I can level a criticism, is that this is quite bourbon heavy in flavor. I wouldnt mind seeing it ratcheted down a bit.

330. Thanks, J! Pours jet black with a dense and creamy dark tan head. Big dense sweet roasty nose, lots of dark chocolate, coffee showing, some dark pitted tree fruit. Sticky thick heavy body with moderate carb. Roasty sweet dark heavy mid palate, with coffee and oak and dark chocolate. Long heavy finish.

Bottle shared by Bruce. This beer met my high expectations. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, toffee, and espresso. Pours black oil with a big brown head. Taste is cocoa, oak, caramel, toffee, french roast coffee, and slight licorice. Just about everything I want a stout to taste like. Now where can I get more?

Pours a deep black with a caramel color head. Nose is full of rich chocolate with a touch of coffee. The palate is a bit dry and bitter, with some nice vanilla notes. Really great beer. Mouthfeel is of the ilk with BCBS.
Deep brown, almost black pour. Reddish brown head. Rich bitter chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, port, bramble berries, tar, molasses. Pretty wicked.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2016 Bottle at Local Option, Chicago, shared with new friend. Looks amazing - deep oaken darkness with mocha foam. Aroma is booze and woody barrel. Taste is a lot of burnt woodiness - touch smokey from ageing. Palate is full and heavy. Overall, think I prefer the original base beer, but definitely need to revisit this one with a fresher palate.
2nd bottle of 2014 vintage at Tims place, 14/1/2016...enjoyed this one much more than first one - great balance between original beer and some vanilla oak. Great sipper though not much scorched bourbon flavours like first time round. Great beer (4.2).

22oz bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon, oak and vanilla, coffee, and very light hints of dark fruits. Flavor the same like dark chocolate fudge. Thick. Surprisingly insanely good.

Pour is black as night, and as thick as tar mixed with motor oil. Aroma and flavor of rich, deep dark chocolate fudge brownie, raisin, fig, date, prune, cinnamon, vanilla toasted coconut, black cherry, molasses, barbeque sauce, marshmallow, leather, tobacco, and spicy rye in the finish. Balanced from beginning of sip through the finish. Body is way north of full, and it carries the aftertaste into a near eternal finish. If I could carp about any aspect of this beer, it would its drinkability, but I wont, because the decadent richness is so all-encompassing that its like a glass of liquid heaven.

Does beer taste better when someone else is putting it on their expense account? Shared this bottle with some beer greenhorns who told me they enjoyed it. They damn well should have. Pours black as oil and nearly as thick with slight light brown head. Scent is coffee, chocolate, and a nasal cavity burning booze. Flavor is sweet with a bite. Appropriately carbonated. Bottle - The Porter Beer Bar - Atlanta, GA

Huge thanks to Galen for sharing this one! Rich, thick, oily viscous black pour with a smallish deep brown head. The nose is absolutely gorgeous, with big espresso roast, smooth coffee, milk chocolate, mocha, dates and plums, vanilla, brandy and cognac, marzipan.... the list goes on. The complexity certainly doesnt let up on the palate, with similar barrel character masterfully intertwining with just enough roasted bitterness to balance, despite the base beer having always been on the slightly sweeter end of the style spectrum. Smooth, a touch of heat midway through, but lovely. This is outstanding.
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Holy Double Barrel Jesus! Amazing! A great beer approved to even higher levels! Outrageously intense.

65cl, brewed at Westbrook Brewing, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2012, thx alot to Koen for sharing!, very complex sweet Stout, roasted/sweet and slightly woody/alcoholic, yet not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

Bottle @ What the Funk Denver 2014. Pours a black appearance with a dark brown head. A lot of chocolate, mild toffee, moderate bourbon, and a bit of roasty / coffee notes in the nose. The mouth feel seemed a bit thin compared to Even More Jesus. Some booze. Dark chocolate, roast, and whiskey throughout. Still tasty but I prefer Even More Jesus a little better.

Pour from bottle at What the Funk!? 2014. Appearance is viscous black with a frothy brown head and great lacing. Big rich dates, plums, figs, cocoa nibs, vanilla, coconut, coffee, roasted malt and wood characteristics in the aroma. Taste is heavy dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, plums, bourbon, toffee, brown sugar, and raisins. Velvety mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Decadent, viscous, and rich, yet somehow well-balanced and drinkable. Solid BA stout.

Black with a thin dark tan head. Huge oak aroma. Sweet coco huge bodied. Very thick and oaky vanila. Smooth 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bomber. 

Pours a dark, dark, brown/black. Aroma is strong on bourbon, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Taste is smooth and full - with delicious merging of a great stout, bourbon, choc, coffee, vanilla, and that touch of rye.

EvilTwin has been my favorite brewer. Biscotti Break and Even More Jesus rank in my top 5 beers. As the barrel aged version of Biscotti Break made that beer even better, the addition of the rye aging added to EMJ...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 03/26/2014. Pours thick black, thin creamy dark tan head rests on the surface, medium ring of lacing built up around the glass. Aroma is rich, moist chocolate brownie, round dark roast malts, vanilla caramel, preserved dark fruits, smooth bourbon integrated in the finish. Taste is chocolate coffee fudge, cherry licorice, sweeter vanilla and toffee blended with darker roast bitterness, espresso, bourbon and touch of booze to finish. Thick, almost creamy body, decadent. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours thick tar black with thick brown head. Beautiful. Nose and taste of bourbon, rye, roast chocolate, roast coffee, vanilla, cherry cordial, oak, fudge brownie, whiskey, sweet chocolate cake, port and dark fruit. Rich and complex. Full bodied. A few months ago, I would have given this a 4.8-4.9, but this style is starting to get a touch too "big" for me.  Still amazingly delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Pours jet black with a small super dark brown head. Lots of toasty malt and oak on the nose, dark bitter chocolate, roasty coffee, caramel and licorice, and a subtle hint of bourbon. Wow, this is a thick oily beer. The muscovado sugar i feel is more prevalent in this than the base beer, plus nice sweet dark cocoa, mocha, lots of oak, a slight spiciness, caramel and molasses, and just the teeniest amount of bourbon. Really really good beer, but maybe not enough barrel character for my liking.

Late edit: Let this warm up. It is sooo much better the closer to room temp it is.

Pours pitch black with no lasting head. Aroma is roasted malty, light vanilla and fruity. Smooth roasted malty, vanilla and light fruity note. Alcohol burn, bitter and dark roasted malty. Lingering dark malty, chocolate and overripe fruity. Port and vanilla smooth finish.

Fanø tap take over @ Dronning Louise. Pours black with a dense light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla, liquorish and bourbon notes. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, alcohol, oak and liquorish. Really nice :-)

Cask (handpump) @ [ Fanø¸ Tap Takeover ], Dronning Louise, Torvet 19, DK-6700 Esbjerg, Denmark.Dark dark black brown colour with a average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, beige head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, dark chocolate, alcohol - bourbon, modrate dark fruit, port notes. Flavour is heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate, dark roasted, alcohol - bourbon - port. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic - buzzy. [20121026]

Cask at Dronning Louise, Esbjerg - Ryans Farewell Party. Pitch black - brown head. High malty. Sweetness. Coconut. Fruity. Wooden. Port wine notes. Licorice. Fullbodied. Vanilla. Wooden. Light tarmac. Lovely. Lots of Jesus and very thick smooth body.

Tap @ Dronning Louise. Pours jetblack with a creamy lasting dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, bourbon. Falvor is malts, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, oak, dark fruits, bourbon and hints of port, some booze. Full body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. Wonderful beer in short. 271012

Cask @ Dronning Louise. Black with a dark brown head that lasted forever. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roassted rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Smooth, soft and oily. 271012

Casque. Black colour, small light brownish head. Sweet aroma of well roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruit. Good filling mouthfeel. Sweet roasted maltiness and dark fruits with chocolate in the flavour with alcohol (vinious). Niiiice.

Cask at Dronning Louise. Had a full pint of this! Pours jet black with a creamy brown head. The aroma is oak, chocolate, bourbon, caramel, light liquorice and roasted malt. Wow cream like thick body. Spicy roasted flavour with notes of vanilla, wine, bourbon, toasted caramel and chocolate. Extremely well made!
Cask @ Fanø Tap Takeover, Dronning Louise. Pours black  with a creamy stable head and lacings. Smooth and soft. Vinous and slick. Coffee, chocolate, roast and a bit of vanilla. A bit of warmth..

Cask at Dronning Louise.
Pitch black coloured with a lasting medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of dark chocolate and licorice.
Sweet and roasted flavour of dark chocolate, oak and alcohol.
Dry roasted finish.

Cask/Hand pump @ Dronning Louise. Black with medium lasting dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, liquorice, wood, medium sweet, hop with notes of alcohol.
